justification: "All participants indicated whether they wanted further information before making their final decision (yes/no)."

measured_by: slider scale 1–50 (little to much additional information)
justification: "Participants indicated how much further information they needed ... on a slider (ranging from 1 = little additional information to 50 = much additional information)."

measured_by: number of snippets selected to read (1–10)
justification: "Participants were ... presented with snippets of 10 fictitious search results ... [and] asked to select the results they would like to read in full (from 1 to 10)."
"We furthermore asked for their preliminary decision certainty (from 0% to 100% certain)."

measured_by: Likert scale 1 (very difficult) to 7 (very easy, reverse-coded)
justification: "The subjective difficulty of making the final decision (Likert-scale, 1 = very difficult to 7 = very easy, later reverse-coded)."

measured_by: Likert scale 1 (not at all / indifferent) to 7 (very much)
justification: "Participants were asked about their satisfaction or disappointment with their decision (both on a Likert-scale ranging from 1 = not at all/indifferent to 7 = very much)."

measured_by: Likert scale 1 (not at all autonomously) to 7 (very autonomously)
justification: "We asked all participants how autonomously they had made their decision (on a Likert-scale ranging from 1 = not at all autonomously to 7 = very autonomously)."

measured_by: Likert scale 1 (not at all) to 7 (very much)
justification: Coin participants rated "whether the coin outcome had endorsed their preliminary decision ... (all on a Likert-scale ranging from 1 = not at all to 7 = very much)."

measured_by: total time spent on charity websites (seconds)
justification: "We operationalized information search as the total time spent on the two charities' websites."
